author: Ashley Winchester
title: Food and Tour News: California Grape Stomp, Caribbean Coral Dives
text:
Our morning travel news digest, with deals, tips and anything else that travelers may want to know.
CAMPFIRE COOKING IN UTAH
Utah’s Conestoga Ranch , a new glamping resort featuring Old West-style accommodations in wagons and tents, is offering a “Camping Culinary Adventure” on the second weekend of September. The package includes two nights’ lodging in a Conestoga wagon or Grand Tent and three camping-themed cooking demonstrations led by chefs from the Park City Culinary Institute. Guests will participate in creating dishes such as artisan pizzas, trout en papillote with potatoes and gourmet variations of skillet s’mores, all using the ranch’s kitchen, wood-burning oven and outdoor fire pits. A sommelier will also be on hand for a seminar on autumn wine choices. From $509.
IN SONOMA, STOMPING (AND SAMPLING) THE GRAPES
